sentence: I just swept a girl off her feet. Im quite an aggressive janitor.
explanation: swept can mean to clean an area with a broom and also refers to someone being romantically taken by surprise.
first_new_sentence: I swept the floor to clean it thoroughly.
second_new_sentence: She was swept off her feet by his charming proposal.

sentence: I tried to make a joke about coins but it didnt make any cents.
explanation: cents refers to a unit of currency and can also mean sense as in understanding or logic.
first_new_sentence: The store offered a discount of fifty cents on each item.
second_new_sentence: Her explanation made no sense, leaving everyone confused.

sentence: A unit of power walks into a bar watt?
explanation: watt refers to a unit of power and sounds like what.
first_new_sentence: The light bulb uses a standard watt of electricity.
second_new_sentence: He didnt understand what I was saying, so he just asked, Watt?

sentence: These jokes utilize words that have dual meanings in the same spelling, meeting your criteria.
